Adequate nutrition and hydration during long training sessions, and maintaining a balanced diet leading up to the race.
Stress and recovery time post-race, including managing fatigue, injury risk, and muscle repair.
Time management balancing training and other responsibilities such as work, school, or family commitments.
Mental preparedness - dealing with nerves, distractions, and maintaining focus during the race.
Proper safety equipment - considering factors like helmet usage in cycling and proper wetsuit selection for swimming.
